issues.description: Non-null assertion on 'values' parameter could cause runtime errors if undefined is passed when baseOrValues is a Base type
URL parsing with base.split('?') only handles the first '?' character, which could cause issues with URLs containing multiple question marks
No validation that parser.serialize exists before calling it, potentially causing runtime errors if a parser without a serialize method is provided
URL hash fragments are not preserved when serializing URLs, leading to data loss if hash fragments are present
Added semicolon before 'use client' directive could potentially cause issues in some Next.js configurations
ExtractParserType<Parser> type assumes Parser has a parseServerSide method that returns a value, but doesn't handle cases where this might not be true
No handling for circular references in the values object, which could lead to stack overflow errors during serialization
